> "The Island City of Thieves" is definitely a fun one (can't remember 
the scen#
> offhand), as well as "Lake Tacona."  "Lake Tacona" is great when 
you've got
> more than one person at the keyboard.

Actually, when I use big teams, I take one player and make the 
character do most of the hard work and let rest of the test do their 
own thing.
 
 Scenarios that set me off a little are the ones that require me to 
pay an inordinate
> amount of attention to my team (which is easily remedied by 
increasing the number
> of HUMAN players).  "The Smell of the Dead" is one of these, where 
the battlefield
> is so open that as long as I'm playing on Battle or Slaughter, there 
is always the
> high chance that my teammates will get very stupid while I go off to 
complete some
> important task (like destroy the tents).

I agree.  Worse yet, my mage will wonder off and get himself killed.

'Tic and Tac' is my biggest pet peeve scenario.  I can only beat that 
scenario when my team works together (we all know how hard that can 
be).
